content.description: Fun and exciting climbing over a bulge
content.protection: A couple pads to cover some rocks at the bottom, good spotter
content.location:
Walk about 20 minutes to the left of the Pathfinder Marina into a gully, follow a dried riverbed to this boulder.

Start on obvious jug at about 4 ft, and climb straight up the horizontal seams

Sit start makes the route just a hair harder.

content.description:
Not sure how to rate cracks very well, this one is burly!

Super good hand crack leaning right that can be seen from the road. Crack flares out at the top, making it difficult to mantel
content.protection: The big slab that the boulder sits on is sloping downwards, so have a few pads and a solid spotter.
content.location:
Shortly after Pathfinder Dam, park off to the left in a sandy pull out, and walk about a hundred yards up the hill.

Big obvious crack that looks "easy"

content.description: This is a very nice bolt-protected friction and face route leading to a walk-off ledge. Starting at the base of the flared, bottoming crack, climb up passing 2 protection bolts to a tricky step right onto the face that is also bolt protected. Three additional protection bolts lead upwards to the finish. This isn't really a sport route, since the bolts are well-spaced. Bolt anchor on the ledge at the top; either rappel the route or walk off left. Could be another sandbag at the 5.9 rating (local standard), but others have thought this might be a 5.10a.
content.protection: Several bolts. Nothing else required other than some quick draws.
content.location: From the parking area, walk uphill following a faint climber's trail to the steep sided "dome: directly to the climbers front, moving uphill. Clueless may be identified by a shallow, flared crack that peters out after about 15 feet.
